newsitem.title: POLAND: BPH buys 28.6 pct of Samopomoc co-op bank.
newsitem.headline: BPH buys 28.6 pct of Samopomoc co-op bank.

text.p: Poland's Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy SA (BPH) has paid five million zlotys for 5,002 shares or 28.6 percent of shareholder votes in cooperative bank Spoldzielczy Bank Rozwoju Samopomoc Chlopska, BPH said.

BPH said in a statement on Friday that it paid for the capital investment using it own funds and that there would be no personnel links between the two banks. It said Samopomoc would remain a separate and legal entity.
BPH also said Samopomoc would regard it as its strategic investor and most important business partner.
It said the two banks would strive to coordinate areas such as market strategy, advertising, branch network development and computerisation.
Poland currently has 1,600 small cooperative banks, 1,200 of them grouped in Bank Gospodarki Zywnosciowej (BGZ).

The agriculture minister said earlier this month that the long process of restructuring Poland's ailing cooperative sector should end this year with the creation of a three-tier system of cooperative, regional and nationwide banks.
